channel.title: The Crows swoop!
channel.description:
Well, I was walking home from school yesterday along some quiet streets in Manchester and I looked up to be amazed by the large number of crows perched on the branches of trees and on electricity wires.
I was unsure of what they were going to do because all or most of them were staring at me but that puzzle was short lived because as I got to the end of the street a group of them attempted to swoop me but to no avail as I ducked out of the way. To be honest it's quite frightening; I mean 10 - 15 of them attacking you!
I've now chosen a new route along some busier roads after this incident. :D
That's just my story from yesterday but has anyone else have similar stories like this?

item.title: The Crows swoop!
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“maniown, post:11, topic:289054”][quote author=PeterMan link=topic=382133.msg2871039#msg2871039 date=1247766955]
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7BI3NbDuCRc&eurl
[/quote]

Lol! Thats a pretty awesome. I wouldn’t expect a seagull to kill a small bird like that.

Also everyone who has seagull problems. Get alka seltzer and feed them to em. They Foam out of the mouth and die![/quote]

That’s because they can’t expel gas.

and hitting a seagull, with anything, is a 50$ fine where i live…

Read full topic

item.title: The Crows swoop!
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

My old dog chases aload of seagulls they followed her for over an hour till we got to the carpark and they started dive bombing her… was quite funny lol

Read full topic

item.title: The Crows swoop!
item.dc:creator: @script_owned script_owned
item.description:
@script_owned wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:7, topic:289054”][quote author=Davidude link=topic=382133.msg2870801#msg2870801 date=1247757028]

We have a gull problem, it’s pretty bad at the moment. Bad weather out at sea so they all come here. Loads of people have had food taken from hands, like 10 people get shat on a day.

heh yeah in my old school at lunch time we used to eat outside and there used to be flock of gulls which would steal food straight out of your hand if you weren’t careful.
[/quote]

some people have fun by having target practice, every now and again someone gets a good shot and the gull just falls out of the sky… but then hobbles away.[/quote]
fuck yeah i go shootin birds at my dock if they shit on it.

Read full topic

item.title: The Crows swoop!
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

I’ve seen hundreds of birds sit on a single telephone wire by a plaza a few miles from my house. Then when they swoop they look like a giant black cloud… it was pretty cool, especially since I was young at the time.

Read full topic

item.title: The Crows swoop!
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

I saw in the news that seagulls were dive bombing people, which could be pretty much fatal as their beaks are rather sharp and they are rather large.

Read full topic
